Reviews.Content: Great beds Not much to comment except to say that the beds are triffic and the location is very central. As previous reviewers mentioned, service is not with a smile and the breakfast is very non discript. The restaurant was empty - the bar area was comfortable and warm. It was November and cold outside. Overall, we would stay there again.
Reviews.Author: Newcast_eUKK_2

Reviews.Content: An excellent and centrally located hotel My wife and I stayed here for three nights. Friendly and effiicient staff, and large and comfortable room. Only two minutes walk from the Duomo. We noticed that the dining room was always empty in the evenings. Breakfasts adequate but not outstanding
Reviews.Author: Geoff55

Reviews.Content: Depressing We stayed at Sofitel Firenze over a long weekend in April. Here is a summary of our stay and I will be as objective as possible.Good points:Nice bathroom (clean, good size), good location (though Florence is small and everything is easy walking distance). Now for the negative points:Our room was absolutely tiny and awkwardly shaped. It was on the third floor, last room at the end of the corridor and there was hardly any room to move around the double bed. The air conditioning was switched off in the room and it was absolutely sweltering unless the window was opened (though this was not a big issue in April). As someone else also mentioned, there was a very strange odour at reception, which hits you as soon as you get through the revolving doors. Not nice.General comments:The staff were fine, but it wasn't exactly service with a smile. On one evening, we asked for assistance in booking a particular restaurant for dinner. We were told that they would phone later in the evening. We ended up making the reservation ourselves. We did not eat their breakfasts or drink in their bar so cannot comment on that The decor in general is a bit old fashioned for my tastes, but that's merely a personal thing.
Reviews.Author: commedesgarcons

Reviews.Content: Great Location! Top notch Sofitel Sofitel FirenzeWe stayed at the Sofitel in the third week in September 2007 for four nights. This hotel is located on a main street in the historic center of Florence/ Firenze about equi-distance between the Santa Maria Novella Cathedral, the Duomo, and the main shopping streets. It is a beautifully converted palace with a small bar and elegant dining room on the ground floor. Our room on the 4th floor was large by European standards, absolutely soundproof and had a spectacular view of a nearby church鈥檚 dome. The marble bathroom had all of the usual first class amenities including a deep tub, plenty of well lighted mirror as well as robes and slippers. The twin beds were comfortable but lacked the luxury bedding the Sofitel hotels in the US enjoy. We had a small closet and dressing area that was poorly lighted. The hotel provides an American style buffet breakfast as part of the room cost. We had a beautiful selection of scrambled eggs, sausage, sliced fruits, cold cuts, and breads/cereals. The service was excellent with wonderful coffee, steamed milk and the buffet refilled continuously. We also ate at the hotel in the dining room and in the bar. We enjoyed delicious food and gracious service throughout.The front desk staff was gracious and competent. A real standout was a young woman who seemed to have an encyclopedic knowledge of the museum schedules, near-by restaurants and the best time to go to high traffic attractions to avoid the lines. I was particularly impressed by her willingness to encourage us to visit the Duomo late in the evening to enjoy the beautiful weather, the extraordinary architecture of the cathedral and the completely unique street scene. We visited the Duomo museum at 9pm and had the Michelangelo Pieta to ourselves and wandered through the exhibits as if on a private tour.This is a great central location within easy walking distance of all of the major sights in this extraordinary city.
Reviews.Author: lesm1981

Reviews.Content: A comfy stay       comfy bed
Reviews.Author: adatrip

Reviews.Content: Average Sofitel Firenze has a very central location, but hotel itself is nothing special. It looks a little bit old-fashioned (but not in a charming way) and boring. The suite we had, was, however, nice, big and clean. Breakfast was very dissapointing.
Reviews.Author: traveller55555

Reviews.Content: A shame Having stayed at the Sofitel Firenze some 14 years ago, we (husband wife) were well aware of its inherent advantages (close to railway station, close to Duomo) and lack of charm. But it was convenient, in particular for Accor card holders (of the kind that leads to upgrades etc.), to stay at a central spot where w'd get a shower on the hot hours between the visits, and a good night' sleep.We got to the hotel before noon, were told our room would be ready in some 45 minutes, left our luggage and went for a stroll. It took us more than 2 hours to get back to the reception desk, all wet from the sudden storm that broke. Nevertheless, our room was still not ready (at 14:25). We stood there, dripping, for another 20 minutes, during which the not-really-polite and hardly helpful personnel was busy re-registering us. The room was standard, darkish (1st floor, courtyard view), functionally furnished. The bathroom was standard as well. It all seemed not to have been redone since the last decade (century!). But (bathrobe and slippers present) it was clean. Or so it seemd. Because an ant strolled along the bathtub - which I courageously drowned and disposed of - only for her to be given a few hours later a funeral-march by her many friends. This time we called the reception, who promptly answered that they were full so no other room was available. A second call was necessary to get an employee come and spray the ants.Our second day started with a mediocre breakfast in the gloomy restaurant. After enjoying Florence, we got back to our room in the late afternoon, went out again, and got back to dress for a late dinner. We were surprised to receive a phone call from the reception, announcing us (at 22:00!) that another room was available for us, for our second and last night there. I went to see it - being on the 3rd floor and with a city view, it was a much brighter one, but neither nicer nor bigger. Given the late hour, we slept in our initial room, leaving the next morning. So to the lack of charm, one should take into account the below-standard service, the unappealing decoration, and the hardly appetizing breakfast before booking. Sofitel can and should do better.
Reviews.Author: HappyTParis

Reviews.Content: "The Stay That Never Was" I had hoped to have been able to write a review of our stay at this hotel at the end of last month but it never happened!We had booked the hotel back in January for a stay commencing on May 26 and had received an emai from the hotel dated May 5 re-confirming our accommodation.When we went to check-in we were told that there were no longer any rooms available for us and that the Sofitel had made alternate accommodation arrangements for us at the Hotel Albani. Our suspicion was that our rooms had been given away to an incoming tour group.Despite complaining loud and hard and even presenting our Sofitel Priviledge card we could not change their minds to give us a room, the hotel claiming it was full. The hotel reluctantly agreed to credit our Priviledge Card account for the stay.Needless to say I will be taking this up with Sofitel and seeking compensation and recompense.To sum up, it would seem having a confirmed reservation doesn't necessarily guarantee a room being available.
Reviews.Author: Steve_Med

Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel in the heart of Firenze After having to cancel reservations in another town due to bad weather, we were able to walk in and make reservations at the Hotel Sofitel. What a treat to be within yards of teh Duomo and restaurants! The room was gorgeous and spacious (A Deluxe Room) and all the price was steep, it was worth it. I Lived in Florence 6 years ago and this was the perfect spot to stay! The staff was polite and even helped us book a hotel in Venice! Cant wait to go back!
Reviews.Author: Vandygirl

Reviews.Content: Well Managed  Just returned from Italy. My wife is a Corporate Flight Attendant and the FBO at Florence airport booked the hotel. I flew on my own into Rome the following day and took the train up to Florence.It was very convenient. About a 5 minute walk from the main Florence train station. That was nice--especially upon arrival when you arrive after a long overnight flight and train connections from Rome to Florence. It was also about a 5 minutes walk to the Duomo.While our room was small by USA standards, the high ceiling made it seem plenty spacious. I don't think alot of Americans realize that most hotels in European city centers are going to have smaller rooms--unless you want to spend $500+ per night. The bathroom was extremely nice. Tub/Shower, bath-robes, hair dryer, toiletries, etc. They have a buffet breakfast in their restaurant. However, since a Continental Breakfast was included in the price of the room, and there was no extra charge to have that breakfast delivered to your room in the morning, we always had the room service. To us, that was a no-brainer. Fill out a card the night before, circle the 15 minute window of time for delivery, and hang it outside your door. We always had our breakfast delivered at the exact time specified. Lastly--it was very clear that this is a very well-managed property. Housekeeping, bar and restaurant facilities, the Room Serivce breakfast, and their Concierge services. Front desk people speak good English and were always helpful.Couple of words of wisdom. Watch out when crossing streets. At least in Florence cars and motorbikes go very fast and think they have the total right of way over pedestrians. And everywhere in Italy there seem to be a number of black African male entrepraneurs selling fake purses and handbags made to look like Gucci, Louis Viutton, etc. They display them spread out on a white bedsheet and are very aggressive in their sales pitch. They also have a lookout stationed nearby. If alerted to Police, they gather up their wares in about half a second and are ready to flee the area. It was comical.
Reviews.Author: golfwesty

Reviews.Content: Occasione persa 鈥?disappoinment grande! The official website begins, The modern Sofitel Firenze is located in the heart of the historic town centre. While this snatch of copy is true, the uninitated to Firenze may not realize that 90% of Florence's hotels can make the same claim. Beyond it's centrality this property represents both a lost opportunity and a great disappointment. Located in a historic building the management chose to renovate the interior in a modern theme that is unsympathetic to the subdued, but classical architecture of the building in which it is located.The rooms are clean, but cramped. Their restaurant, Il Patio is acceptable, but like the rest the property has to offer it's overpriced for what you receive, and it is hardly seductive enough to lure you away from other dining opportunities in Florence. I can imagine eating there if one is really tired, but I can't envisage locals bringing guests there to show off.The service isn't objectionable, just mediocre. No special touches, or flourishes. After staying at their sister property, Sofitel Roma near the Via Veneto, the d茅cor and service was an unexpected disappointment. In the clutter of transnational ownership I believe Sofitel still claims to be the upscale brand of the French accommodations giant, Accor Hotels. While not quite a Red Roof Inn, this property doesn't meet the expectation of the Sofitel cachet. Rather than sully the brand this property should probably carry their Novotel, or even Mercure designation.Could one find a worse hotel in Florence, but of course! However, the management team that renovated this property has abused the opportunity to add another jewel in the Sofitel crown and settled for a hotel that is clean, but overpriced 鈥?a commodity that can be found anywhere in the world. The historic town center of Florence deserves more, as does Sofitel's clientele.
Reviews.Author: GeorgeFarris

Reviews.Content: Overall Above Average I believe this hotel is above average, however, the hotel is not on par with other Sofitels throughout Europe. When we checked in, we were shown a tiny room that had a view of a brick wall. Needless to say, we requested a change and were given a better room that was large, had a view of the Duomo (if you craned your neck), and was much better overall. The room was awkwardly shaped though with a weird long corridor going down the side.As I said, this hotel was not to the same level of other Sofitels, such as, the bathroom was tile and not marble. Although not a big deal, it is somewhat less nice than other Sofitels. As others stated, the key is location. It is a 5 minute walk to the train station and a 5 minute walk to the Duomo. However, one quickly realizes that Florence is not as large as Rome and most things are a few minutes walk from everywhere else. It is not on a charming street, but rather the street that goes directly to the train station. This is not a criticism, but merely a comment. If a person is going to Florence and seeking romance and charm, the Sofitel may not be the best hotel. However, if one is looking for convenience and easy access to the train station, it is a good location.I was pleased with the desk staff and they were helpful after changing our rooms. They had good recommendations for places to eat, but for the most part, we had our own itinerary and used them for directions and making reservations. I would recommend the hotel if it can be gotten at a good price by people who want to spend their time sightseeing, however, I would not recommend it for honeymooners seeking a charming place to wile away the hours.
Reviews.Author: Rockemsockemrobot

Reviews.Content: Convenience is the key ... The summary for this hotel can be defined in one word ... convenient.The hotel is conveniently located within a 4 min walk of the train station. The hotel is conveniently located within a 5 min walk of the Duomo which basically anchors the city. The hotel was 8 min walk to a huge variets of restauaunts in any general direction. The deluxe room in which we stayed for $350 CDN a night, did not offer great views of the city or anything but was convenient in its layout of the room, the very comfortable shower and most importantly it was very quiet during the evening. In a city with such a hustle and bustle atmosphere it was a per convenient retreat.One of the few criticisms I could spell out was once there the service at the front desk was hospitable but set in their ways. As an example we tried to book a wine tour that we found in a brochure, the front desk had been pushing a private car for us to use instead (they must make a profit somewhere) and then they said the tour was booked. We called the agency organizing the tours our selves and we were 2 of only 6 on a tour that held up to 20 people.All in all ... great hotel.
Reviews.Author: LP 05

Reviews.Content: all around good The location was great - two blocks from the Duomo! Even better two blocks from the train station. The service was very good, although other hotels had a better grasp of English. The bed was great - didn't feel like it was two twins pushed together as in most other hotels.Ultimately the bathroom is what we were most happy about. It was big. The shower had good water pressure. It was actually a shower/tub combo - ooohhhhh, luxury!
Reviews.Author: stoshsmom

Reviews.Content: Great Hotel! This was a great hotel in Florence. The location is within walking distance of the train station and if you take a taxi it isn't too expensive but the one way streets make you go a bit out of the way as opposed to walking.The hotel is only about three blocks from the Baptistry and Duomo - maybe a five minute walk. The San Lorenzo Church and Markets are also about five minutes walk away. You can easily walk to the Ufizzi Gallery, the Ponte Vecchio and Santa Croce. There were many good restaurants in the area - just go looking down the side streets.The rooms was a very nice size - the same size as most American hotel rooms. The bathroom was luxe with bathrobes and slippers for use while you were there. Beds were very comfortableThe desk staff were very helpful.Breakfast was in a very nice room, food was good - typical assortment of breads, yogurt, jams, eggs, bacon or sausage depending on the day, cheese, juices etc.The bar was well stocked and the barman was very nice.
Reviews.Author: SRQRedhead

Reviews.Content: Great hotel We stayed at the Sofitel in July ( incredibly hot in Florence) and enjoyed a spacious room, great buffet brerakfast and super front desk service. In particular when my purse was stolen the first day of our trip .(Be very aware when you are eating in the cafe's particulary if you have a table on the outside.....it was gone in a SECOND...) The front desk staff assisted us for the entire time, cancelling credit cards, translating etc. Very patient and aplogetic.Other then that...a great experience....Don't miss the statue of David....unbelievable!
Reviews.Author: ford45

Reviews.Content: It's OK. Comfortable but lacks atmosphere. We stayed at this hotel in Florence for three nights in July. We were shown to a very small dark room with a view of a brick wall. Also, the air conditioning was not working properly - so we asked to be moved to a different room. The hotel staff were very nice about us changing rooms. It wasn't a big deal.The Sofitel in NYC is so much better than this one. But this Florence Sofitel is an 'OK' hotel. The rooms were comfortable but small. The beds are really great. No problem sleeping at this hotel! It's in a good location near the train station and close enough to walk everywhere in Florence. The bar lacked atmosphere. It was always empty and quiet. The breakfast served in the restaurant was pretty good. It was typical of a European breakfast buffet.I might stay at the Sofitel again but for the price we paid I just wonder if we could have found a better hotel? I'm not sure. It's 4 star but pretty average. Florence was VERY HOT but a fun city. It's a shame about all the illegal street vendors - they really detracted from a beautiful city. I think two days in Florence is long enough to see everything you want to see.
Reviews.Author: Reader

Reviews.Content: Superb, elegant, cozy, magnificent. I love modern ammenities and comfort. If you also do, this is the best choice in Florence. Believe me. I have tried 3 other horrible hotels. Florence has many bad accomodations. Be on the safe side.
Reviews.Author: gatototo

Reviews.Content: Wonderful Hotel The Sofitel in Florence was excellent. It was in a great location and it was close to everything we wanted to see. The staff was extremely helpful and knowledgeable. They even recommended a few resturants for us to visit. The room was very nice. It was quite clean and more spacious than I expected. The audio system in the bathroom was a nice surprise. Staying in the Sofitel made it much easier to enjoy our stay abroad.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Wonderful! This hotel has a great location, within easy walking distance to just about everything. The rooms were clean and well maintained, with beautifully appointed and upscale bathrooms. Amazingly, despite being in the middle of the city, the rooms were very quiet. Most important, the staff was gracious, helpful and courteous. We felt so at home each morning as we were greeted by Mario and Vincenzo, our hosts for the lavish breakfast buffet!
Reviews.Author: rosie413

Reviews.Content: Best Location In Firenze, you want to be as near to the Duomo as possible. This hotel is also near the train station. It was clean, quiet, everything worked, except AC. I think during the winter/spring the hotels do not turn on the AC. Opening the windows for a couple of minutes is fine. Service was excellent but don't order room service anywhere in Italy. There are so many fine eating establishments everywhere. Especially Il Porcupino Trattoria near San Lorenzo.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Belissimo! My wife and I had a wonderful stay at the Sofitel Firenze. From the minute we walked into the lobby everyone was more than helpful, polite, and just plain warm and welcoming. Sure, its a bit pricey (800 euros for three days), but it was worth it!
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Pricey, but worth it if you feel like treating yourself! So, first off, this place isn't cheap...but in this case, you do get what you pay for. I stayed here last June, and it was a calm, cool oasis amid the hot, crowded streets of Florence. I'd already been to several locations in Italy by the time I got to Florence, and the Sofitel was the perfect end to a lovely trip. My room had a view of Il Duomo, which was nice to look at in the evening/early morning when floodlit. The hotel is in a wonderful location, and employs a very friendly/helpful/attentive staff which spoke flawless English. There is also a cool, quiet lounge to enjoy a glass of Chianti in on a hot afternoon. My room was small but sumptuous, and the marble bathroom was incredible! Nice attention to detail with mints on the pillow along with the following days weather report. If you've got the means, give yourself a real treat by staying at the Sofitel Firenze!
Reviews.Author: Halinmich

Reviews.Content: Great hotel in excellent location Stayed at the Sofitel for 3nts in December. Room was nice, plenty of room and spotlessly clean. Could not hear any noise at all even though the hotel is situated on a main road.Location could not be beaten, within walking distance of the station and no more than 5-10 mins walk of every major site in Florence.Hotel staff were unobtrusive but friendly when approached. Buffet breakfast was good with plenty of choice of hot and cold dishes which were constantly replenished.Overall a first rate stay-would not hesitate to stay there again and would recommend.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Hot Location, Cold Service Sofitel Firenze has excellent (large, well-equpped and comfortable) rooms and a perfect central location with views of the Duomo. However, the usual Sofitel experience was somewhat tainted by a staff that seemed more stand-off-ish and put-off by doing their jobs than welcoming to the international clientele. I understand some vigilance is necessary when trying to operate a higher-end establishment in a high traffic tourist area. But, even as a Sofitel Priviliged Guest (loyalty card) member, the token free drink card barely covered the chilly welcome I received prior to presenting my Priviliged Guest membership card and although I only had one piece of luggage, it would have been nice to at least have been offered assistance. I hope a minor attitude adjustment is made before my next trip to Firenze, as the location can make up for poor treatment once, but probably not twice.
Reviews.Author: one_spod

Reviews.Content: great hotel in Florence The Sofitel was great! We stayed there for three nights and loved it. Great area, good room (very big) and really great brekfast buffet. Would definately recomend it!
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Great place in a good area of Florence Stayed here for two nights because first hotels reservations got cancelled. The hotel is very modern and clean - In a good location because close to all tourist interests but not completely in the hectic center. The rooms were large and clean with lots of nice extras - Would stay again if went to Florence again .
Reviews.Author: sc4eva

Reviews.Content: Very Convenient My wife and I stayed for one night based on the reviews on this page.... great advice! We had our little 18mo boy in tow... so we had him in a stroller in addition to pulling our luggage from the train station per the instructions on one of the other reviews, it worked out great and the walk with all our gear was only 10 minutes. The staff was great, very accomodating with crib, late checkout, and coming up to fix electrical problem immediately, and very helpful with baby chair at the included huge breakfast buffet, and late night milk refill for the baby bottle. Bathroom and room were fantastic. Only thing is I booked for 150 euros on my corporate website, when I arrived they said that room was only for single occupancy, so I said upgrade to double and they charged 200. Big deal it was worth it. Internet was not free, 10 euro/hour!!, but that is the going rate in Italy I found. Also close to sights, easy walking around Florence.We walked our gear back to the train station and left town, piece of cake. Would stay again for sure.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Excellent After reading many positive reviews about this hotel, I booked 3 nights here and we were very pleased with our stay back in April 2004. We are a family of 3, with a 7 yr-old child, and the walk from the train station was very easy, even with the crowds in the afternoon. Our room was luxurious and the bathroom excellent, with all the conveniences. The staff was friendly and helpful. The breakfast room, service, and food was also very good. We would recommend this place.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Sofitel was very good We stayed at the Sofitel for four days and it was a very nice experience. We did not notice any construction and the room was clean, quiet and comfortable. The staff was very accommodating as well. The location is great and we would definetely stay here again without hesitation.
